caption: The service was good, and they did a good job cooking my rare steak. However, the menu was too limited, and the food was not worthy of the price tag. There is better food in the area for that price.
Excellent food and service. Highly recommended!
Excellent bar and food. Wonderful staff
Food was outstanding and our server was excellent and knowledgeable about the entire menu. Very pleasant experience.
Food is great. Service is warm and welcoming. Our ‘go to’  in Huntsville whenever we visit. Never disappoints.
Great food, variety of whiskey, top notch service
Great food
Absolutely fantastic as always. The service was incredible and only surpassed by the exceptional food and drinks. It was the perfect seeing for date night with my lovely wife. Highly recommend.

My husband took me to Purveyor for my birthday. It was great! I had the squid ink pasta with king crab and uni, and he had the roasted chicken with butternut squash puree.  Also, the restaurant is abiding by social distancing guidelines.
It was okay, but overpriced for what you got.
We were there for the first time with a table of 5 on saturday night before Valentines Day and both the food and service were awesome !!°

We had the oysters as an appetizer followed by the roasted whole fish with beech mushrooms and french fries.  For drinks we had sparkling water, cocktails, and hot tea.  The desert was a white chocolate, strawberry cake masterpiece.  Best service and food we have had anywhere in Huntsville.  We will now make fewer trips to Nashville each month to enjoy a good restaurant.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

New chef and a big reduction of the menu. We were sad to see many appetizers gone. The $45 filet tasted more like a steak you'd get from Texas Roadhouse.  This was a place we used to spend $150+ and feel we got our money's worth and then some. We will no longer eat here though, which is sad.
Nicest restaurant in Huntsville. Always excellent food and cocktails. Would definitely recommend!

We visited Purveyor for our anniversary and the whole experience was great. Our waiter was friendly and amusing. He went over the specials in great detail and brought out a couple of different wines until we found one that we like enough to pair with our meal. The bone marrow was amazing, if it is on the menu you have to try it. I could have kept eating that all night. The scallops were delicious but my husband definitely needed more to eat afterwards. I had the bass. It was divine. I’m not a huge fish person but the flavor was delicate and everything paired well together. The menu is constantly changing based on what is in season so I look forward to visiting again.

Excellent service, Damion was very attentive. Food was AMAZING! Love the cozy atmosphere, we are new to Huntsville and this is our new favorite place in town, will definitely be back! Can't decide what our favorite dish was, can't go wrong with the scallops, filet, taglitelle, foie gras, brussel sprouts, French fries...definitely recommend the Vasco de gama though!

Service is impeccable, the flavors were amazing, and the attention to detail on my old fashioned was totally on point.  The ONLY reason for withholding a star is because I can't give a half star deduction for the seating configuration.  Our table was awkwardly placed and we just felt like we were in the way.  Huntsville's other higher end dining have a more intimate seating arrangement.  With the MINOR issue of the seating, my dinner was great and well worth the higher price point.

My husband and I met a friend at Purveyor for dinner. They serve a mixture of "ordinary" foods in a skillfully artistic and delicious way as well as unusual combinations that are equally delicious. However, you pay for this creativity, so I consider it more on the expensive side.
Food was delicious and Shelbee, our server, was very kind, personable, and knowledgeable.

Our server was very attentive and the manager (I assume) visited our table as well and chatted with us which made our dining experience all the more pleasant. In these uncertain days, our dinner was a wonderful escape to a culinary paradise!  We will be back for sure and I can hardly wait!! Bravo to the culinary artist/chef/ team!!!

Fantastic food and service. Fortunate to have eaten here over the past two years. Cannot go wrong with Ahi Tuna and French BBQ wings along with seasonal main dishes created by the head chef along with Church Street Wine Shoppe. Great high quality, upscale dining experience.

The occasion for our second visit was the celebratory supper for a friend's birthday.   Our party consisted of two couples and we were showered with attention by our server,  Tony.  The cocktails were very good and the ensuing red blends were equally pleasing.  The prime rib was extremely well prepared and truly satisfied two, as advertised.   This is a wonderful place and an experience to be anticipated.
You can’t go wrong here. Drinks. Food. Experience. Too notch. Top five in Huntsville.
Great menu... wonderful service.  Highly recommend for an amazing meal.
This was a awful experience. My 40 th anniversary the service was awful. My prime rib was burnt . Such a let down for a big occasion
Awesome ... great service!
Amazing 👏
Amazing food
Got a take-out Thanksgiving meal here.  Really enjoyed it, and it was great having so many sides without the cleanup!
Superior food and service. Carefull wait staff covid minded.  Needs a tap for pabst blue ribbon beer.

We go about twice a year. It's more of a luxury for us, Valentines and Anniversaries. I am a former chef and foodservice professional so it's really hard for me to eat out, much to my wife's dismay. Because it's hard to "wow" me. A lot of great dishes on the menu, but most I am familiar with in different ways and versions. Meaning: I can't say I had it prepared EXACTLY the way they do it. BUT WHEN WE DO eat out, and its a nice romantic ambient nuanced dinner, this is a top pick in Huntsville. Not just for food alone, there is a great wine selection BUT I am most impressed by the BOURBON selection. My wife is allergic to beef, JUST BEEF, (not lamb, bison, fowl, or seafood)...so that takes away about a third of the menu currently. That is NOT a complaint, merely for your information. We like to share many small plates or appetizers (you may call them) as a meal AND even dinner plates we share. ALTHOUGH the stone crab was good, we frequent Florida because of family so the price was high for us (but we ARE in North Alabama).  We had the Seared U-8 Scallops dish, and that was great...BUT NOW the STAR for our palate was the BLACK COD, Outstanding! ...Miso glaze, forbidden rice, marinated beech mushrooms, baby bok choy... Great service, great food, great wine, excellent bourbon...we asked in our reservation for a cozier "out of the way spot" and that was accommodated! Thank you!

Haven’t tried the food but if they’re on par with the drinks, then WOW. Very pleased, and the crafty folk behind the line whipping up those drinks, you all get 5+ stars. Thank you, it was our first stop downtown on my wife and I’s six year anniversary and at no point did you disappoint.
Food was awesome.  Fresh and non traditional.  Unique taste and excellent ambience
Greate place, very expensive but is worth it, excelent service, and the food is awesome

This place is the bomb! Best spot I've eaten at in Huntsville. Had the A-5 Wagyu as a starter. Very delicious. For entree we got the Kan Kan Pork Chop. Chop was very tender and the accompanying pork belly was the best pork belly I've ever had. Melt in your mouth, fork can cut meat.
Ok I'm impressed.
Outrageously expensive for what you get. Portions small but very tasty. Drinks very well made but again very pricey.
Best food, atmosphere,  and attention to detail!
Over priced and they're very proud of it. Food was under cooked. Service was slow.

The service was good. I had a reservation for 7:45pm and I had to wait to get inside, then I waited 30 minutes for my steak which was a little bit burnt. I ordered medium and I got medium well. It was over priced for the quality of the steak. The ceviche had too much ginger and it is missing ingredients as everyone knows the ceviche is Peruvian and this was a poor imitation.

My wife and I celebrated her birthday at Purveyor on 9/17/2020. We always prefer to support local businesses. After very good service we were disappointed our food came out lukewarm. $59 for a steak should not be served lukewarm. Of course the "heated" the meal up and it just wasn't the same. Very disappointed.
The food was very good and wait staff was personable and very helpful in explaining the dishes.

Date night was a success! We heard that Purveyor had a new chef and we didn't know how this would change things. I didn't think that Purveyor could get any better.. but it leveled up. The duck balls weren't on the menu but they assured us they will return. A5 Waygu was worth $30 for 2 ounces! The food was perfectly seasoned and the staff is top notch attentive.
My wife's favorite place. The new chef is awesome.
Wow.  I didn't think I could get food this good in Huntsville.
Great food and drinks. A little on the pricey side but worth it.

This was my favorite restaurant in town. Every time I went my taste buds exploded with flavor and It was incredible. However, this last time after a new chief was introduced, it was... good. It just wasn't amazing as it was in times past unfortunately.
Amazing food coupled with a great wine selection.

We were aware the chef had recently left to pursue other options, so when we were invited to join good friends for dinner, we were curious and a little apprehensive as to what to expect. The verdict: a flawless execution of three simply fresh dishes (but very hard to execute for those inept). Snapper Ceviche, tuna crudo and a whole (yes, eyes and tail!) whole snapper for two. Superb! Now all that remains is for us to see the our beloved octopus back on the menu...If none of this floats your boat, fear not, cooking up delicious dishes are a win win if you crave the good fare that comes from  meticulously sourced ingredients and mindful cooking. Thank you ffg or not disappointing us!
Worth every penny

Fantastic dining experience. I recommend the 3 course meal as it is all so good! Worth the money. We had the ahi tuna tacos as an app, Golden tile fish and the duck as the entrees, and the cheesecake as dessert. Very good.
Great cocktails. Great food

I have eaten at Purveyor twice and had a five star experience both times. This was not the case for my anniversary dinner Friday night. The service was adequate and the cocktails were great (as always), but my entree was terrible. I ordered the fish special, black grouper. It was served in a bowl of bok choy soup. The fish itself was foul, and the entire dish didn't feel thought-out. I'm not sure if COVID-19 has put a strain on restaurant supply chains, but that fish should have been thrown out weeks ago. The summer menu just felt lackluster. I have been a fan of Purveyor, but was disappointed with this visit.
Price very high but nice

One of the best places in town for upscale food and cocktails. The food is excellent.  The dishes and cocktails are creative and well executed.  The atmosphere is great (except for the lack of lighting.  It's super dark in there.)  It's very expensive, but a great way to impress a date. Would go again.  2018 update (One bad experience) They were pushing the 'special' which was a prawn and a steak.  Meals at this restaurant run about $45/plate.  One would think the 'special' would be around that price or less.  Negative.  When the bill came, we found that this prawn and steak cost $93  That's not the entire bill.  That's one dish.  That's about double everything else on the menu.  I asked if it was a mistake but was told it was accurate.  I understand it's on me for not asking about the price, but I felt deceived at the price and the lack of upfront warning that it's wildly more expensive than anything else on the menu.  2020 update The service was fantastic, no surprises on the bill.  The meals were pretty good.  The side dishes were amazing (curry lentils and spaetzle), but the duck was lacking flavor.  The cocktails were great.  Will go again.
A little pricey but the food and drinks are both top notch.

Fantastic, excellent, delicious. Great drinks, great service, great food. We had watermelon salad with an add of the special Tasmanian salmon which was amazing. Also had the halibut catch which was equally amazing. Had the tuna poke tacos app and love those!  It's the best I've had in Huntsville lately. Shelbee was our server and did an excellent job.

Purveyor was really good! Since Miss Rona shut a lot of things down, this was the best food we've had in awhile. I also love how downtown Huntsville is coming up. This location isn't far from where I stay while I'm in HSV. It was mine and my husband's 5 year anniversary, so we went to dinner with my mom. I looked on Yelp and saw this restaurant and the food looked good so we decided to give it a try. I'm glad we stopped by, it was a great decision and the food was impressive! The set up of how this location ran was also interesting. Due to Miss Rona, they had tables set up outside, of course 6 ft apart. They had a card propped up on the table with a number to call and place your order when you are ready. The host brings you a menu. You look at the menu and decide what you want to order. You then call the number and place your order. Your order will come out in a bag and to-go packaging for you to be able to eat outside. It isn't the prettiest packaging but it works.  We ordered different entrees and shared sides & a shareable plate. Between the three of us we ordered the Old-Fashioned Burger, Bahn Mi Burger, Scallop Squid Ink Pasta, Four-Cheese Cream Spinach, Jalapeño Cream Corn, Parmesan Herb Fries, Duck Meatballs, Ponzu Brussels Sprouts, and Bread Pudding. Yes, it was a lot of food but it was all so good! We also tried drinks. I think my husband had an Old-Fashion and I had a cocktail. To be honest, their drinks aren't anything special. I wasn't impressed with the drinks as I was with the food.  Old-Fashioned Burger - REALLY GOOD! My mom had this burger. 8 oz black angus ground beef, with cheddar cheese, heirloom tomatoes, red onion, house-made pickles, mixed greens, and chipotle ginger mayo *ADD: applewood smoked bacon $3. This was good for her because she eats really healthy and tries not to eat beef but once a week. She actually really enjoyed this burger. It was huge and full of flavor. Certainly a good burger.  Bahn Mi Burger - REALLY GOOD! This burger was on the specials menu. It was like a Bahn Mi sandwich but in burger form. It was very flavorful and huge. I tried a bite of this and it was a lot but so good! It was a nice twist on a burger.  Scallop Squid Ink Pasta - GOOD! George's bank scallops, squid ink pasta, pepper, onions, huitlacoche, tito's bell pepper crème sauce. This dish was good. I just started coming around to eating scallops and these were good. The pasta was cooked perfect and the sauce was good.  Four-Cheese Cream Spinach - GOOD! This side dish was decent. It was seasoned well and very creamy. My only complaint about this dish was that the spinach wasn't chopped. It was left in whole pieces. This was a little different than what I'm use to.  Jalapeño Cream Corn - VERY GOOD! This was the best creamed corn I've ever had. It was seasoned well with a slight kick. It was creamy and crunchy. I loved this side dish!  Parmesan Herb Fries - VERY GOOD! These were fries cooked in rendered beef tallow and topped with Parmesan and herbs. The best seasoned fries I've had! Ahhhmazing!  Duck Meatballs - GOOD! Hudson Valley duck meatballs, tamarind & pineapple yellow curry, black truffle pâte shavings, asiago foam. This dish was different. The meatballs were good and tender. They came in a curry sauce. I'm use to meatballs being in a marinara sauce or a chili glaze. However, this was a nice twist.  Ponzu Brussels Sprouts & Pork Belly - REALLY GOOD! This dish was really good and the pork belly added some nice flavor. They were cooked perfect.  Bread Pudding - GOOD! Cinnamon condensed milk, bourbon caramel, milk chocolate mousse. We love bread pudding so it was a no brainer to try. This bread pudding was pretty good. It wasn't the best we've had but it was good. The fruit and caramel was a nice touch to it!  Overall, Purveyor was really good and we enjoyed their food. I'd certainly come back!

Service A++++  Atmosphere A+  Food Quality A+  I really love purveyor. Their Ahi tuna tacos are fabulous to start with. The filet is always cooked to perfection and the service is awesome. I have never once seen my water glass get below half. Everyone is constantly checking on tables.
Some of the Best food in Huntsville
Great food and  Drinks
Great food, and Matt is the best bartender in Huntsville!
Great drink selections
Excelent service, bone marrow was excelent.
Easily the best bar in Huntsville

No idea how Cotton Row is rated higher than Purveyor; it's not even close in my opinion. Purveyor is the clear winner! Given the rest of my meals in Huntsville I wasn't expecting to be wowed when we went but I was wowed! Matt, the bartender, should open up his own bar. I had the Old Fashioned and it was one of the best drinks I've had all year and that's not an exaggeration. Matt is top level mixologist and those are a rarity. Even if you don't end up going to Purveyor for a meal, go and have Matt prepare you a drink.
Staff not friendly. Made reservations and no table when I got there.
One of my favorite steaks in Huntsville.  Intentional menus, informed staff, friendly management.
